intro: Euphrasia filicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has hairy stems and produces numerous tiny flowers that bloom in the spring. Euphrasia filicaulis is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
